original_title: Sri Lanka divestitures expected in fourth quarter
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s state enterprise unit is expecting to make the first divestitures in the fourth quarter of 2023, Director General, Suresh Shah said.
A government procurement is now evaluating bids for transaction advisors to planned divestitures, Shah told a forum organized by the central bank.
Transaction advisors are required to value the companies. They will also prepare a data room for prospective bidders to conduct due diligence, he said.

Legitimate investors usually want to conduct detailed due diligence before committing billions of rupees to buy assets, he said.
Among firms listed for sale are SriLankan Airlines which has debt, Sri Lanka Telecom, Sri Lanka Insurance, Lanka Hospitals and Litro Gas.
Sri Lanka Insurance is now working on splitting its general and life businesses, prior to divestiture, Shah said.
The move is expected to be completed by the end of August, he said. (Colombo/June15/2023)
